html:
12.16.23  1:18 am   Hi, Bill Fair warning this may be a long and somewhat abstract question, and I apologize if this kind of question has been asked and answered before. I've been a fan of yours for several years now and enjoy many of your songs. The lyrics especially have intrigued me and sometimes puzzled me throughout the years. I've noticed in the past when folks have asked you questions about the "deeper meaning" to the lyrics of your songs you coyly respond with answers that read something along the lines of "deeper than what?".

     that's because "deeper" is a comparison word (the "er" on the end). like "bigger, smaller", ... etc, if you use the word, you have to say the other thing we're comparing it to. sometimes people just say, like "is this lamp darker?" .... so i have to say "than what" because i need that second object to compare to. it's very hard to compare something to nothing. or at least i don't know how to do it

      I'll admit, I once asked you a question like this several years ago on this pageand indeed received a similar answer. At the time I felt quite miffed, butthen I soon saw that many folks were asking this kind of question, and I believe I was asking the wrong question. You see, over theyears I kept thinking about this question I asked and your answer from time to time, and i think it started to make me ponder about the relationship that music artists can have with their songs, their fans; and the interpretation that their fans have of their music. I've seensome artists, when asked the question "what's the meaning of song [X]?", have a specific message in their mind they want song [X] to display, or perhaps a certain story they want the song to tell. In contrast, I have seen other artists not explain any specific "deeper meaning" to the songs that they make, and indeed these artists say that a song means whatever the listener feels they mean.

     that's not how i react to the question -- almost every time, it's just the simple grammar conundrum, in the mechanics of the "er" suffix

      For example, your song "And The Day Goes On" (one of my favorites!): I like this song a lot, and to me, the "meaning" of the song is to persevere and press on when life gets stressful or tough. However, I understand that others may not interpret this song the same way that I do, and it really doesn't matter to me how others interpret the song - I like it for what it is for me. But this does get somewhat to the crux of my question, and it's a hard question for me to articulate because I've never tried to write songs before. I'm not looking forcontext about certain songs, but I am curious in general about the relationship artists may have with their published work. When you write songs, do they ever have a certain "meaning" to YOU?

     yes, and the final song recording represents my best attempt at conveying that. if you find me using actual music/audio/song/graphic etc, then you can be sure that words alone weren't enough. in fact, they're barely enough now, to answer this question. i almost need music just to answer the question. so i'd certainly need music to express the things that i've used music to express. in other words, it would be impossible for me to express what i've had to use music to express, without music. indeed sometimes people come along and say something like, "can you express what you were trying to express in that music, except without using any music in your answer?" and the answer of course is no or i wouldn't have needed the music

      Do you write songs hoping that your audience will interpret them in their own way and enjoy the song for what it is, regardless of what the song may (or may not) mean to you? Or is the process completely different? I'm curious about your thoughts on this idea.

     the most profound meaning is certainly processed locally in the individual (within the mind of the person viewing/listening), so indeed it would be expected that everyone's peak meaningful experience might be slightly different. that's just the way it goes, in the 'feels' business

      Thank you and take care!

12.16.23  1:17 am   what's your favorite question that's been asked to you, and what's your favorite question asking about what your favorite question is that's been asked to you?

      it's a tie for first place, amongst all of the ones that don't deal with favoritism in any way

12.16.23  1:15 am   how to make friends?

      impossible. it can't be done

12.16.23  1:07 am   Would you agree that different languages are kind of like different musical instruments?

      i was going to say no, maar nu ik erover nadenk, dan toch ja

12.16.23  1:05 am   Funniest phrase you've heard recently?

      'phrase'

12.16.23  1:02 am   how to deal with wanting to create things but feeling extremely incompetent in my ability to do so

      learn about how incompetent some of your favorite creators have felt

12.16.23  12:59 am   is a given name more important than a chosen name, or is it the other way around?

      given, taken, chosen, .... those could all be the exact same scenario unless we specify who's doing the giving, taking, or choosing

12.16.23  12:19 am   What genres of music do you like 

      none of them

12.15.23  11:49 pm   Do you ever plan to write a book?

      no, but i'll write just about everything else that i can

12.15.23  11:45 pm   What do you think about living on earth

      it's partly sunny

12.15.23  11:25 pm   how do i know what to do with my life?

      keep it simple: just do everything

12.15.23  11:01 pm   Is it justified to deprive yourself of something you might enjoy because of your prior notions of whether you would enjoy the thing or not, even if your notions are base on prior negative experiance with a thing of a similar nature?

      sure-- especially considering the 'might enjoy' part wouldn't actually be part of the person's reasoning -- that part only comes from the counter-argumentator's reasoning

12.15.23  11:00 pm   Do you like board games?

      i respect them

12.15.23  10:18 pm   Favourite kind of music?

      'kind of' music

12.15.23  10:02 pm   have you ever looked at a previous project and think it could've been made better?

      yes

12.15.23  9:56 pm   how do you come up with melodies for your songs?

      i just imagine something

12.15.23  9:51 pm   Do you find stories enjoyable?

      it really seems like they could be

12.15.23  9:42 pm   What's your favorite trading card game

      trading 1 card for another card that's exactly the same

12.15.23  9:35 pm   What is the weirdest game you have ever played?

      doing my work

12.15.23  9:31 pm   What's the most current impossible situation you've thrown yourself at?

      doing my work

12.15.23  9:25 pm   What do you do when you're sad?

      i'll think of something

12.15.23  8:57 pm   should we be afraid of the ocean? 

      a little

12.15.23  8:37 pm   what instrument do you enjoy the most?

      street signs

12.15.23  8:31 pm   What's happening right now?

      almost everything, but not quite

12.15.23  8:23 pm   how good is your handwriting?

      it's about as good as yours

12.15.23  8:18 pm   do you have a font you don't particularly like or refuse to use on a project?

      no

12.15.23  8:17 pm   In your opinion what is the appeal in mumble rap?

      could be anything, including but not limited to the mumbling

12.15.23  8:02 pm   Who is your favorite artist of all time

      i doubt it's possible to have, in one time, a favorite of all time

12.15.23  7:41 pm   directions to mcdonald's

      go in any direction

12.15.23  7:31 pm   Where do you conjure up motivation 

      it's the other way, motivation conjures me, but it could happen anywhere

12.15.23  7:23 pm   Did you teach yourself everything you know

      some of it

12.15.23  7:07 pm   how should i spend my day

      spend 1/3 of the day making plans for the future, 1/3 of the day doing plans from the past, and 1/3 having no idea what's going on

12.15.23  7:06 pm   What is the oddest food you know?

      i don't know any odd foods

12.15.23  6:56 pm   Do you think my parents will ever appreciate what I do?

      will you

12.15.23  6:49 pm   how can i make friends

      probably just by being exactly who you are

12.15.23  5:56 pm   What is an ending?

      i'm really not sure

12.15.23  5:32 pm   what is the best animal

      time will tell

12.15.23  5:13 pm   how many edgeloops is too many

      the exact amount you've done

12.15.23  5:11 pm   what nice thing happened to you today?

      the earth rotated effortlessly around its axis

12.15.23  4:50 pm   has anyone ever asked you this question before?

      yes, this is in fact one of the most common questions

12.15.23  4:39 pm   whats 2+2?

      out of control

12.15.23  4:30 pm   do you think names have much significance?

      some

12.15.23  4:20 pm   why do you think humans are so much more creative than other animals?

      somehow that doesn't seem like a fair comparison

12.15.23  4:13 pm   do you think a person just does not exist anymore after they leave your sight

      no

12.15.23  4:06 pm   are you on the spectrum 

      even better, the specturm i'm on might be on a spectrum of spectrums

12.15.23  4:01 pm   Is there a music genre you particularly don't like?

      no

12.15.23  3:53 pm   How do you pick your chords? I'd love to hear a detailed description of your approach. Thank you so much for your music

      it's the same way words are chosen, when you use language. so it's a lot like lightning, or magnetism, or something like that

12.15.23  3:52 pm   Whats your favorite organ

      B3

12.15.23  3:39 pm   should i try to learn the accordion?

      you could

12.15.23  3:32 pm   HELP I just realized that language is math and math is language, what do I do??

      i think language might be more like an art, than math
